video_description:
Our Final Thoughts - http://www.futurelooks.com/the-asus-eee-pad-transformer-tf101-and-keyboard-dock-reviewed-video/

http://www.futurelooks.com - Futurelooks completes their long term test of the ASUS Eee Pad Transformer and the accompanying keyboard dock. This Tegra 2 powered 10.1 inch device has been one of the most popular Android powered tablets on the market and there are some very good reasons for that. Stephen and Michael weigh in on the things that give the device its well deserved praise.

Follow Us On Twitter:
http://www.futurelooks.com/twitter

Like Us On Facebook:
http://www.futurelooks.com/facebook

Don't forget to rate, comment and subscribe to this channel!
title: Futurelooks Reviews the ASUS Eee Pad Transformer (TF101) and Keyboard Dock

comments.text: 1st.﻿
comments.author: Mario Haro

comments.text: asus stuff has always rocked i got a old expensive laptop of theirs thats 11 years old, still works and build﻿ quality is rock solid.
comments.author: 69fuzzynutz

comments.text: if u like gaming install tegrazone from app market for tegra 2 optimized stuff, also you might want to consider one with more memory as certain large﻿ apps and games only work from the internal memory as do widgets. app2sd is'nt supporting honeycomb yet due to the mount points for media.
comments.author: 69fuzzynutz

comments.text: it doesn't even﻿ have 3g
comments.author: kevinsmammaxd

comments.text: why i hate android is coz no unicode support...shame on android.﻿
comments.author: LimpMan1

comments.text: If you would have done some research you would have﻿ known that ASUS Eee Pad Transformer have both WiFi-version and a 3G-version.
comments.author: Cbham100

comments.text: Asus should have made the dock to be able﻿ to hold memory, and hard drive capacity. it would really make this tablet stand out.
comments.author: PCTechTalks

comments.text: The keyboard dock has two USB ports and an SD card slot. You can put a 64GB card in there and plug in two more 1TB hard drives into the USB ports. You can even use one USB port to power an external flash card reader to offload all your photos or video to an external hard drive on the other port. This is why the ASUS dock already stands out. In fact, after filming, we used the dock to﻿ transfer footage from camera to external hard drive :)
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text: Dont really need 3g just﻿ tether it to a 3g phone with wifi or bluetooth
comments.author: 69fuzzynutz

comments.text: hard drive capacity is only limited by the file format i think honeycomb uses ntfs and my external harddrive is 2tb ntfs﻿ format so it should support it although i havnt tried.
comments.author: 69fuzzynutz

comments.text: ASUS =﻿ CHINESE hahaha
comments.author: Jonathan Rivera

comments.text: Actually, it﻿ equals Taiwanese.
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text: **Does the Polaris﻿ Office App on the tablet support Excel Drop down cells. Please post video response if possible.
comments.author: cptmoe88

comments.text: Don't know﻿ since we use Excel for fairly basic things. Try emailing Polaris directly for a better response.
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text:
Polaris doesn't have an email, and their secretary can't string two English words together. If you watch: "Create﻿ Drop Down List in Excel Worksheet Cell"
it shows how to do it in excel. then all you have to do is copy the file onto your tablet and check its functionality. Please help me, I've been searching everywhere and will need to purchase multiple tablets if this works!
comments.author: cptmoe88

comments.text: That's﻿ a pretty cool product.
comments.author: JoshuYT

comments.text: Very nice review. How does one load movies on it? Ios is so﻿ easy for adding movies.
comments.author: munimack

comments.text: Easier than iOS. Drag and drop your very own﻿ files by hooking the Eee Pad to any computer via the USB cable. If it doesn't play a particular file format out of the box, you can choose from several players in the Android Market. Most are free.
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text: Good review﻿
comments.author: aPinar1

comments.text: well as I now China dont think the same... could you explain me the﻿ difference between china and taiwan please ?
comments.author: Jonathan Rivera

comments.text: I hate capacitive﻿ screens... Windows + capcitives = fail
comments.author: ultranet

comments.text: awesome review make me have more confidence to investment this gadget even though I already have used an iPad at work, but I love the keyboard﻿ docking station combine with Asus tablet
comments.author: tmitchable

comments.text: can you use a usb cd/dvd drive with﻿ it?
comments.author: futuerpurdueman

comments.text: Which﻿ is better this or the Acer Iconia A500? Which do you recommend?
comments.author: labrysong

comments.text: Have not﻿ tried it. If we get a chance, we'll report back.
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text: If the A500 was substantially cheaper. And we're talking well over $100 less, then the ACER would be﻿ a great buy. But the ASUS is the better machine and the keyboard integration is fantastic.
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text: absolutly﻿ loved this review!!! thank you
comments.author: manhiacita420

comments.text: Nice video,﻿ very helpful thanks...
comments.author: martine7777e7

comments.text: Probably a﻿ stupid question but can you connect to the internet via mobile broadband or is it only WiFi?
comments.author: lukedunkerley99000

comments.text: WiFi only. There are no﻿ drivers for a USB modem AFAIK. But you can use a portable modem as a WiFi hotspot.
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text: Although this product is a year of, should i still purchase it? I'm very interested in it, but also unsure.﻿
comments.author: TheXIII21

comments.text: If they announce Jelly Bean 4.1 update for TF101, then you should get it. It's already a great tablet, it'll be fantastic with the Android update. Hopefully ASUS comes through.﻿
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text: Do you know if Asus has patched all the bugs and stuff? I﻿ know its a miss or hit in most cases, but I don't want to upgrade the OS to ICS and have crashes and stuff.
comments.author: TheXIII21

comments.text:
Our unit with the latest ICS updates has no issues related to the hardware itself. Any crashes that happen seem to be due to apps behaving badly. The more popular apps are all stable, but some of the less﻿ frequently updated ones can have problems. But again, not the fault of the device.

If ASUS pledges support for 4.1 Jelly Bean, then this tablet is a no brainer at the prices it is clearing out for.
comments.author: Futurelooksdotcom

comments.text: Okay, thanks so much, man! In definitely buying it, thank﻿ you!
comments.author: TheXIII21

comments.text: Thanks for the comments guys.  I﻿ think I will pick up this tablet; it sounds like a solid pick.
comments.author: Troy Green

comments.text: Thanks for the﻿ review!! I can't wait to get mine!
comments.author: collinsfamilyvideos
